get.summary: Download a graph as a zip file
get.description:
Download the compressed graph reference by the hash in a zip file
Note: This endpoint is activated only if `csm.platform.twincache.useGraphModule` property is set to true

get.summary: Get the details of a Dataset

404.description: the Dataset specified is unknown or you don't have access to it

post.summary: Upload data from zip file to dataset's twingraph
post.description:
To create a new graph from flat files,  you need to create a Zip file. This Zip
file must countain two folders named Edges and Nodes.

.zip hierarchy:
*main_folder/Nodes
*main_folder/Edges

In each folder you can place one or multiple csv files containing your Nodes or
Edges data.

Your csv files must follow the following header (column name) requirements:

The Nodes CSVs requires at least one column (the 1st).Column name = 'id'. It
will represent the nodes ID
Ids must be populated with string

The Edges CSVs require three columns named, in order,
* source
* target
* id

those colomns represent
* The source of the edge
* The target of the edge
* The id of the edge

All following columns content are up to you.
Note: This endpoint is activated only if `csm.platform.twincache.useGraphModule` property is set to true

post.summary: Refresh data on dataset from dataset's source
post.description:
Refresh dataset from parent source. At date, sources can be:

    dataset (refresh from another dataset)

    Azure Digital twin 

    Azure storage

    Local File (import a new file)

During refresh, datas are overwritten
Note: This endpoint is activated only if `csm.platform.twincache.useGraphModule` property is set to true

post.summary: Rollback the dataset after a failed refresh
post.description:
Rollback the twingraph on a dataset after a failed refresh
Note: This endpoint is activated only if `csm.platform.twincache.useGraphModule` property is set to true

get.summary: Download a graph compressed in a zip file
get.description: Download a graph compressed in a zip file

post.summary: Create a new graph
post.description:
To create a new graph from flat files,  you need to create a Zip file. This Zip
file must countain two folders named Edges and Nodes.

.zip hierarchy:
*main_folder/Nodes
*main_folder/Edges

In each folder you can place one or multiple csv files containing your Nodes or
Edges data.

Your csv files must follow the following header (column name) requirements:

The Nodes CSVs requires at least one column (the 1st).Column name = 'id'. It
will represent the nodes ID
Ids must be populated with string

The Edges CSVs require three columns named, in order,
* source
* target
* id

those colomns represent
* The source of the edge
* The target of the edge
* The id of the edge

All following columns content are up to you.

delete.description: Delete all versions of a graph and his metadatas

post.summary: Upload a file for the Workspace

destination.description:
Destination path. Must end with a '/' if specifying a folder.
Note that paths may or may not start with a '/', but they are always treated
as relative to the Workspace root location.

use_file_name_as_is.summary: Use the file name as is as destination

upload_to_workspace_root_under_a_differe.summary: Upload to the Workspace root folder, but rename the target file

upload_to_a_folder.summary:
Upload to a sub-folder.
Destination may or may not start with a '/', but must end with '/' to be treated as a directory.
Final file path will always be relative to the Workspace root location.

upload_to_a_specific_folder_and_under_a_.summary:
Upload to a sub-folder.
Destination may or may not start with a '/', but must not end with '/'.
Final file path will always be relative to the Workspace root location.

get.summary: List all Scenarios by validation status

200.description: the list of Scenarios by a given validation status

key.description: the Connector key which group Connector versions

repository.description: the registry repository containing the image

version.description: the Connector version MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH. Must be aligned with an existing repository tag

ownerId.description: the user id which own this connector version

url.description: an optional URL link to connector page

azureManagedIdentity.description: whether or not the connector uses Azure Managed Identity

azureAuthenticationWithCustomerAppRegist.description: whether to authenticate against Azure using the app registration credentials provided by the customer

parameterGroups.description: the list of connector parameters groups

label.description: the list of translated parameter group labels

options.description: the list of available and valid values for the parameter

envVar.description: associated environment variable in connector image

label.description: the list of translated parameter group labels

ContainerResourceSizing.description: a description object for resource requests and limits (default same configuration as basic sizing)

ownerId.description: the User id which own this Dataset

organizationId.description: the Organization Id related to this Dataset

parentId.description: the Dataset id which is the parent of this Dataset

linkedWorkspaceIdList.description: list of workspace linked to this dataset

refreshDate.description: the last time a refresh was done

connector.description: the Connector setup bound to a Dataset

fragmentsIds.description: the list of other Datasets ids to compose as fragments

compatibility.description: the list of compatible Solutions versions

solutionKey.description: the Solution key which group Solution versions

minimumVersion.description: the Solution minimum version compatibility (version included)

maximumVersion.description: the Solution maximum version compatibility (version included)

DatasetCompatibility.description: a Dataset compatibility constraint to a Solution version open range

options.description: freeform options to path to connectors

datasetTags.description: the dataset tag list to search

accessControlList.description: the list which can access this Dataset with detailed access control information

DatasetTwinGraphInfo.description: a twin graph query in cypher language

DatasetTwinGraphQuery.description: a twin graph query in cypher language

enable.description: Activate or Deactivate historical data deletion

pollFrequency.description: define the polling frequency of scenario run status (in millis)

DeleteHistoricalData.description: Configuration of scenario runs deletion automatic mecanism

nodes.description: list of filename found on nodes folder

edges.description: list of filename found on edges folder

source.description: the source node of the relationship

target.description: the target node of the relationship

name.description: the name of the graph data object

params.description: the parameters of the graph data object

accessControlList.description: the list which can access this Organization with detailed access control information

baseUri.description: the platform base uri for this service

platformService.description: the Platform service associated to the resource

resourceUri.description: the Organization specific uri for this service resource

credentials.description: a freeform credentials object. Structure depends on service

tenantCredentials.description: a freeform credentials object for the Organization tenant. Structure depends on cloud provider

OrganizationServices.description: the cloud service resources of the Organization

OrganizationTenantCredentials.description: a freeform credentials object for the Organization tenant. Structure depends on cloud provider

QueryResult.description: the result of a SQL Query

workflowId.description: the Cosmo Tech compute cluster Argo Workflow Id to search

csmSimulationRun.description: the Cosmo Tech Simulation Run Id

generateName.description: the base name for workflow name generation

workflowName.description: the Cosmo Tech compute cluster Argo Workflow Name

ownerId.description: the user id which own this run

workspaceKey.description: technical key for resource name convention and version grouping. Must be unique

computeSize.description: the compute size needed for this Analysis. Standard sizes are basic and highcpu. Default is basic

datasetList.description: the list of Dataset Id associated to this Run

parametersValues.description: the list of Run Template parameters values

containers.description: the containers list. This information is not returned by the API.

Run.description: a Run with only base properties

runArgs.description: the list of run arguments for the container

dependencies.description: the list of dependencies container name to run this container

solutionContainer.description: whether or not this container is a Cosmo Tech solution container

nodeId.description: the node Id which has executed this log

children.description: the list of children node id

logs.description: the node logs in plain text

RunDataQuery.description: a data result query in SQL

RunLogs.description: the run logs returned by all containers

RunResourceRequested.description: the memory and CPU requested by the pod

runTemplateId.description: the Solution Analysis Id to search

workflowId.description: the Cosmo Tech compute cluster Argo Workflow Id to search

workflowName.description: the Cosmo Tech compute cluster Argo Workflow Name

generateName.description: the base name for workflow name generation

RunStartContainers.description: the parameters to run directly containers

workflowId.description: the Cosmo Tech compute cluster Argo Workflow Id to search

workflowName.description: the Cosmo Tech compute cluster Argo Workflow Name

phase.description: high-level summary of where the workflow is in its lifecycle

message.description: a  human readable message indicating details about why the workflow is in this condition

hostNodeName.description: HostNodeName name of the Kubernetes node on which the Pod is running, if applicable

message.description: a human readable message indicating details about why the node is in this condition

phase.description: high-level summary of where the node is in its lifecycle

csmSimulation.description: the Cosmo Tech simulation name. This information is send to the Engine. Mandatory information if no Engine is defined

tags.description: the list of Run Template tags

computeSize.description: the compute size needed for this Run Template. Standard sizes are basic and highcpu. Default is basic

noDataIngestionState.description: set to true if the run template does not want to check data ingestion state (no probes or not control plane)

fetchDatasets.description: whether or not the fetch dataset step is done

scenarioDataDownloadTransform.description: whether or not the scenario data download transform step step is done

fetchScenarioParameters.description: whether or not the fetch parameters step is done

applyParameters.description: whether or not the apply parameter step is done

validateData.description: whether or not the validate step is done

sendDatasetsToDataWarehouse.description: whether or not the Datasets values are send to the DataWarehouse prior to Simulation Run. If not set follow the Workspace setting

sendInputParametersToDataWarehouse.description: whether or not the input parameters values are send to the DataWarehouse prior to Simulation Run. If not set follow the Workspace setting

preRun.description: whether or not the pre-run step is done

run.description: whether or not the run step is done

postRun.description: whether or not the post-run step is done

parametersJson.description: whether or not to store the scenario parameters in json instead of csv

parameterGroups.description: the ordered list of parameters groups for the Run Template

items.description: a Run Template Group Parameter id

stackSteps.description: whether or not to stack adjacent scenario run steps in one container run which will chain steps

gitRepositoryUrl.description: an optional URL to the git repository

runTemplateSourceDir.description: an optional directory where to find the run template source

executionTimeout.description: an optional duration in seconds in which a workflow is allowed to run

RunTemplateHandlerId.description: the Run Template step handler identifier

RunTemplateOrchestrator.description: the Orchestrator to use for the Run Template

varType.description: the variable type for the parameter. Basic types or special type %DATASETID%

defaultValue.description: the default value for this parameter

minValue.description: the minimum value for this parameter

maxValue.description: the maximum value for this parameter

regexValidation.description: a regex to validate the value

isTable.description: does the group define a table

parentId.description: the Run Template Group parent Id

parameters.description: an ordered list of Run Template Parameters

RunTemplateParameterGroup.description: a Parameter Group for a Run Template

value.description: the parameter value

RunTemplateParameterValue.description: the value of Analysis parameter for a Runner for this Run

RunTemplateResourceSizing.description: a description object for resource requests and limits (default same configuration as basic sizing)

RunTemplateStepSource.description: the source local, cloud or git repository

ownerId.description: the user id which own this Runner

solutionId.description: the Solution Id associated with this Runner

runTemplateId.description: the Solution Run Template Id associated with this Runner

lastUpdate.description: the last time a Runner was updated

runTemplateName.description: the Solution Run Template name associated with this Runner

datasetList.description: the list of Dataset Id associated to this Runner Run Template

parametersValues.description: the list of Solution Run Template parameters values

allOf.description: the last Runner Run for this Runner
the last Runner Run for the parent of this Runner
the last Runner Run for the root (master) of Runner

parameterId.description: the parameter id the values refer to

value.description: the parameter value for the reference Runner

comparedValue.description: the parameter value for the compared Runner

RunnerChangedParameterValue.description: the difference between the values of a parameter

runnerId.description: the Runner Id which is the reference for the comparison

comparedRunnerId.description: the Runner Id the reference Runner is compared to

changedValues.description: the list of changed values for parameters

RunnerComparisonResult.description: the result of the comparison of two runners

id.description: the Runner Data Download job identifier

csmSimulationRun.description: the last Cosmo Tech Simulation Run id

RunnerResourceSizing.description: a description object for resource requests and limits (default same configuration as basic sizing)

value.description: the parameter value

isInherited.description: whether or not the value is inherited from parent or has been changed

RunnerRunTemplateParameterValue.description: the value of a Solution Run Template parameter for a Runner

accessControlList.description: the list which can access this Runner with detailed access control information

RunnerValidationStatus.description: the validation status of the runner

solutionId.description: the Solution Id associated with this Scenario

comparedValue.description: the parameter value for the compared Scenario

scenarioId.description: the Scenario Id which is the reference for the comparison

comparedScenarioId.description: the Scenario Id the reference Scenario is compared to

ScenarioComparisonResult.description: the result of the comparison of two scenarios

id.description: the Scenario Data Download job identifier

csmSimulationRun.description: the last Cosmo Tech Simulation Run id

ScenarioResourceSizing.description: a description object for resource requests and limits (default same configuration as basic sizing)

workflowId.description: the Cosmo Tech compute cluster Argo Workflow Id to search

generateName.description: the base name for workflow name generation

ownerId.description: the user id which own this scenariorun

workspaceKey.description: technical key for resource name convention and version grouping. Must be unique

computeSize.description: the compute size needed for this Analysis. Standard sizes are basic and highcpu. Default is basic

sdkVersion.description: the MAJOR.MINOR version used to build the solution solution

noDataIngestionState.description: set to true if the run template does not use any Datawarehouse consumers (AMQP consumers for Azure)

datasetList.description: the list of Dataset Id associated to this Analysis

parametersValues.description: the list of Run Template parameters values

sendDatasetsToDataWarehouse.description: whether or not the Datasets values are send to the DataWarehouse prior to Simulation Run. If not set follow the Workspace setting

sendInputParametersToDataWarehouse.description: whether or not the input parameters values are send to the DataWarehouse prior to Simulation Run. If not set follow the Workspace setting

containers.description: the containers list. This information is not returned by the API.

ScenarioRun.description: a ScenarioRun with only base properties

runArgs.description: the list of run arguments for the container

dependencies.description: the list of dependencies container name to run this container

solutionContainer.description: whether or not this container is a Cosmo Tech solution container

nodeId.description: the node Id which has executed this log

children.description: the list of children node id

logs.description: the node logs in plain text

ScenarioRunLogs.description: the scenariorun logs returned by all containers

ScenarioRunResourceRequested.description: the memory and CPU requested by the pod

key.description: the Solution key which group Solution versions

repository.description: the registry repository containing the image

alwaysPull.description: set to true if the runtemplate wants to always pull the image

csmSimulator.description: the main Cosmo Tech simulator name used in standard Run Template

version.description: the Solution version MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH. Must be aligned with an existing repository tag

ownerId.description: the User id which own this Solution

sdkVersion.description: the MAJOR.MINOR version used to build this solution

url.description: an optional URL link to solution page

parameters.description: the list of Run Template Parameters

parameterGroups.description: the list of parameters groups for the Run Templates

accessControlList.description: the list which can access this Solution with detailed access control information

name.description: the source name containing the files to import

location.description: the source location containing the files to import

path.description: the source location containing the files to import

SubDatasetGraphQuery.description: a twin graph query in cypher language

TranslatedLabels.description: a translated label with key as ISO 639-1 code

TwinGraphQuery.description: a twin graph query in cypher language

repository.description: the registry repository containing the Validator image

version.description: the Validator version MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH. Must be aligned with an existing repository tag

ownerId.description: the User id which own this Validator

url.description: an optional URL link to Validator page

Validator.description: a Validator to validate a Dataset

id.description: Workspace unique identifier generated by the API

organizationId.description: Organization unique identifier under which the workspace resides

key.description: technical key for resource name convention and version grouping. Must be unique

name.description: Workspace name. This name is display in the sample webApp

linkedDatasetIdList.description: list of dataset linked to this dataset

ownerId.description: the user id which own this workspace. set by the API from Authentification service receved id

sendInputToDataWarehouse.description: default setting for all Scenarios and Run Templates to set whether or not the Dataset values and the input parameters values are send to the DataWarehouse prior to the ScenarioRun

useDedicatedEventHubNamespace.description: Set this property to true to use a dedicated Azure Event Hub Namespace for this Workspace. The Event Hub Namespace must be named \'<organization_id\>-<workspace_id\>\' (in lower case). This Namespace must also contain two Event Hubs named \'probesmeasures\' and \'scenariorun\'.

dedicatedEventHubSasKeyName.description: the Dedicated Event Hub SAS key name, default to RootManageSharedAccessKey. Use the /secret endpoint to set the key value

dedicatedEventHubAuthenticationStrategy.description: the Event Hub authentication strategy, SHARED_ACCESS_POLICY or TENANT_CLIENT_CREDENTIALS. Default to the one defined for the tenant.

sendScenarioRunToEventHub.description: default setting for all Scenarios and Run Templates to set whether or not the ScenarioRun is send to the Event Hub

sendScenarioMetadataToEventHub.description: Set this property to false to not send scenario metada to Azure Event Hub Namespace for this Workspace. The Event Hub Namespace must be named \'<organization_id\>-<workspace_id\>\' (in lower case). This Namespace must also contain two Event Hubs named \'scenariometadata\' and \'scenariorunmetadata\'.

datasetCopy.description: Activate the copy of dataset on scenario creation, meaning that each scenario created in this workspace will make this copy. when false, scenario use directly the dataset specified.

dedicatedEventHubKey.description: the dedicated event hub shared access key

accessControlList.description: the list which can access this Workspace with detailed access control information

solutionId.description: the Solution Id attached to this workspace

runTemplateFilter.description: the list of Solution Run Template Id to filter

defaultRunTemplateDataset.description: a map of RunTemplateId/DatasetId to set a default dataset for a Run Template

options.description: free form options for Web Application

ioTypesEnum.description: The read and write capabilities of connector
